item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 28, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Global Solar Council announces 2 terawatt milestone achieved for solar (11 points | 1 comment)
2. A Pretty Visualisation of the European Power Grid (2022) (31 points | 7 comments)
3. Malware can turn off webcam LED and record video, demonstrated on ThinkPad X230 (880 points | 462 comments)
4. Show HN: Myphotos.site – Make a gallery website from Google Photos (101 points | 38 comments)
5. Writing Composable SQL Using Knex and Pipelines (18 points | 11 comments)
6. Jazz Kissa (47 points | 17 comments)
7. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (32 points | 13 comments)
8. Australia: Kids under 16 to be banned from social media after Senate passes laws (209 points | 272 comments)
9. Bananas: Cross-Platform screen sharing made simple (102 points | 22 comments)
10. Synology patches unannounced multiple zero-day vulnerabilities (5 points | discuss)
11. You can use C-Reduce for any language (407 points | 92 comments)
12. Spatial Pixel: a new kind of social computing (4 points | discuss)
13. Pissed off by Spotify Enshittifying more API endpoints? We can help (11 points | 1 comment)
14. Seoul blanketed by heaviest November snow on record (24 points | 2 comments)
15. Linux Kernel Performance Bottlenecks Spotted by Mold Developer (9 points | 4 comments)
16. Futures and Multiple Values in Parallel Lisp (1991) [pdf] (10 points | discuss)
17. In Praise of Print: Reading Is Essential in an Era of Epistemological Collapse (192 points | 180 comments)
18. The New Climate Math on Hurricanes (19 points | 6 comments)
19. PRoot: User-space implementation of chroot, mount –bind, and binfmt_misc (95 points | 33 comments)
20. Who Is Jay Graber, the CEO of Bluesky? (50 points | 47 comments)
21. Qodo automatically verifies PR complies with Jira ticket or GitHub issue (6 points | 8 comments)
22. Show HN: TeaTime – distributed book library powered by SQLite, IPFS and GitHub (250 points | 51 comments)
23. MIT Aluminum Bicycle Project 1974 (2016) (142 points | 101 comments)
24. London's 850-year-old food markets to close (166 points | 128 comments)
25. Conversational Game Theory (99 points | 31 comments)
26. The Forgotten Story of How IBM Invented the Automated Fab (143 points | 30 comments)
27. Show HN: Feels Like Paper (215 points | 78 comments)
28. Float Self-Tagging (150 points | 25 comments)
29. Developing a cancer drug without Big Pharma: this hospital shows it can be done (146 points | 108 comments)
30. Structured Editing and Incremental Parsing (104 points | 28 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 28, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
